definition: Bulgaria/Bulgarian/abbr. for 保加利亞|保加利亚[Bao3 jia1 li4 ya4]
to defend/to protect/to keep/to guarantee/to ensure/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)
to guard/to protect/to defend/abbr. for 衛生|卫生, hygiene/health/abbr. for 衛生間|卫生间, toilet
surname Wei/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1066-221 BC), located in present day Henan and Hebei Provinces
see 不列顛戰役|不列颠战役[Bu4 lie4 dian1 Zhan4 yi4])
pinyin: Bu4 lie4 dian1 Bao3 wei4 zhan4

definition: Domestic Security Protection Bureau, the department of the Ministry of Public Security responsible for dealing with dissidents, activists etc
pinyin: Guo2 nei4 An1 quan2 Bao3 wei4 ju2

sentences.english: To de fend our country we must strengthen ourselves.
sentences.chinese: 为了保卫祖国，我们必须自强不息。

sentences.english: After he graduated, he joined the army and devoted himself to making his motherland safe.
sentences.chinese: 毕业之后他参加了部队，献身于保卫祖国。

sentences.english: Australia invoked the treaty to come to our defense.
sentences.chinese: 澳大利亚援引同盟条约来保卫我们。

sentences.english: At six o'clock, the hospital security buzzed my room.
sentences.chinese: 在六点钟，医院保卫科叫我。

sentences.english: Compassion for fellowmen gives me courage in safeguarding life.
sentences.chinese: 有慈爱之心，就有勇气保卫生命。

sentences.english: The aggressive elephants are simply defending their territories, apparently.
sentences.chinese: 很显然，这些大象只是在保卫自己的领土而已。

sentences.english: They took up arms in defence of their country.
sentences.chinese: 他们拿起武器保卫祖国。

sentences.english: The goal seems to be to defend the royal family from criticism.
sentences.chinese: 该法案的目的似乎是保卫王室，使之免于批评。

sentences.english: They fought to defend their country.
sentences.chinese: 他们为保卫祖国而战斗。

sentences.english: Incarnated one of your favorite heroes from naruto in a battle to defend you village.
sentences.chinese: 从火影忍者中挑出您最喜爱的英雄，保卫你的村落。

sentences.english: We must defend the fruits of our victories.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须保卫我们的胜利果实。

sentences.english: You've got to be able to defend in the China-Taiwan Strait.
sentences.chinese: 你还必须要能够保卫台湾海峡。

sentences.english: After this gruesome tale the easing of the siege comes as an anticlimax.
sentences.chinese: 在这令人毛骨悚然的故事之后，保卫战形势突然好转。

sentences.english: Though they do not broodily guard their patch with bristling security.
sentences.chinese: 但是他们不用通过沉思默想重重安全来保卫领土。

sentences.english: They responded at once and rose as one man in defense of their motherland.
sentences.chinese: 他们立即响应，团结得象一个人，起来保卫祖国。

sentences.english: Being attacked on all sides, Rome had to call back her armies to protect what was left of the empire.
sentences.chinese: 罗马四面受敌，只得调遣军队来保卫帝国仅存的部分。

definition: to hold on to/to defend/to keep/to guard
to seize control of (an enemy position)/(fig.) to take by storm/to gain (awards, control of a market etc)
